item.title: Madison add a quote by Sylvia Plath
item.description: "God, but life is loneliness, despite all the opiates, despite the shrill tinsel gaiety of "parties" with no purpose, despite the false grinning faces we all wear. And when at last you find someone to whom you feel you can pour out your soul, you stop in shock at the words you utter - they are so rusty, so ugly, so meaningless and feeble from being kept in the small cramped dark inside you so long. Yes, there is joy, fulfillment and companionship - but the loneliness of the soul in its appalling self-consciousness is horrible and overpowering." -- Sylvia Plath

item.title: Madison add a quote by Jean-Paul Sartre
item.description: "Little flashes of sun on the surface of a cold, dark sea." -- Jean-Paul Sartre

item.title: Madison add a quote by Sarah Kane
item.description: "It is myself I have never met, whose face is pasted on the underside of my mind." -- Sarah Kane

item.title: Madison add a quote by Albert Einstein
item.description: "The most incomprehensible thing about the world is that it is at all comprehensible." -- Albert Einstein

item.title: Madison add a quote by Vladimir Nabokov
item.description: "It was love at first sight, at last sight, at ever and ever sight." -- Vladimir Nabokov
